YqtBOHguusiGk3rLilM3Vw.text: It would be a little ridiculous for me to review the food in this place. It's got a Michelin star, and, if the rumours are right, it's on the brink of another. So just accept the food is really incredible. In fact, it's more than food. It's art. Art you can eat. The very best kind of art. So instead of talking about the food, I'm going to talk about my experience of Restaurant Martin Wishart.  First off, it was my 21st when I went. A big occasion. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated like royalty. The waiters (all men, all French) were attentive but not intrusive. When they weren't needed they sort of lurked in the shadows, then appeared out of nowhere ready to assist.  We had the tasting menu with the matching wine menu to go with it, plus the supplementary cheese board coz we're greedy. Now it has to be said that this cost approximately the same as a small yacht, or 6 weeks in the Seychelles (that's hyperbole!), but it was really worth it. Our waiter talked us through all the wines, explaining why it matched. And when we'd finished they brought me a plate which had petit fours delicately arranged and 'Happy 21st Birthday' written in chocolate. A very, very special experience indeed.

irpZr5986JCuiAXtrELLPw.text: Yum, Yum, Yum Great food , great people, great night. We did the tasting menu, and the chef made special accommodations for all of us. The lobster and scallops were sublime. I don't think its possible to have anything that doesn't taste extraordinarily delicious. However this place is expensive, going back would be probably a few years from now :) But a friend of mine suggested this great App on the ipad called great british chefs thats has Martins recipes, so if I wanted to I could try to recreate some of the yumminess at home. greatbritishchefs.com

WIhPy6oOJ32FESFOGhnInw.text: Faultless food and service, we enjoyed the tasting menu with wine, and managed the extra cheese course too, a beautiful menu and good wine list. Would definitely recommend a visit

dCa3cc0Or4KyIXNW_Svylw.text: This restaurant thoroughly deserves its Michelin star. The service is, as is to be expected, immaculate. The food delicious and different. Try the tasting menu to experience a range of taste treats and wonderful wines to accompany them. Skip the coffee though.

Of9aqfloJpYZ6lHj_6J8Qw.text: OK this was one of the best places in Scotland we had in our tripl The artichoke soup was rich creamy with flavors of truffles and a great dish.  We had the tasting course and found it a pretty decent tastng menu.  There were about 2 stand out dishes like the soup and the rest were about a 7-8 which in our personal 1-10 rating is pretty respectable.  I would give this place about a 8 to 8.5 out of ten.  It was a solid performer but not yet at a French Laundry level but worth a visit if you are traveling to Scotland or for a special occasion.

RL3Dh9zmaZkhFh_pRGGe2Q.text: Every time someone tells me that there is no place to eat a good food in UK I always think about fresh fish in Ullapool and about Martin Wishart (maybe The Grainstore as well) in Edinburgh and about a few others but the MW will be always my favorite. I chose this place for my wedding dinner. Starter: Millefeuille of veal sweetbreads & Kindeys; Main Course: Roast loin of burnside farm rabbit; dinner: cylinder of jivara chocolate + coffee espresso/espresso macchiato(the best I've ever got on the island) .

bnxNjWi7sJmsz957uZVZUw.text: The service is impeccable, the food amazing (though not in my opinion better than the Three Chimneys in Skye), along with a fantastic wine list. I had the tasting menu with wine, and an extra cheese course which is well worth the experience. I don't really like the decor though, but that seems to come part and parcel with Michelin starred restaurants.

z8ZoXRDy0GqQd-R1juaMNw.text: I've been to Martin Wishart so many times, and I have to admit its one of my favourite restaurants EVER, and I've been to many good eateries both at home and abroad. The atmosphere there is really good, and I can't commend it enough. Obviously the best thing about this place is the food, which is simply amazing. So well prepared, fantastically presented, with a really good wait time (quick compared to other 'posh' restaurants). You really can't beat the selection on the menu at Martin Wishar, and the prices aren't too bad either. The staff are also fantastic, which really leads me to recommend this restaurant. One of the best in Edinburgh!

g1k_ff86WvME6W-qNBCVBg.text: This was the best restaurant I've ever had the pleasure of enjoying. I'll 100% return and will recommend it as a must-visit when in Edinburgh. The 6 course tasting menu was marvelous. Each dish was beyond perfection as was the vegetarian tasting menu my cousin enjoyed. The service was impeccable. The setting, magical. I can't IMAGINE what one must do to get more Michelin stars because this place is pretty close to purfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom

qYL2J8Y4zCovdgdrUnwPWw.text: My hubby and I were in Scotland for our 25th anniversary and decided to "have a slap up meal" (as our local host called it) in honor of the occasion. This ended up being the best meal we've had in 23 years. Hubby went with the 8 course menu that honestly had some things that scared me, so I went with the 6 course vegetarian menu instead. However, my fears were unfounded (he let me taste his). Snail ravioli, squab and even pig trotters were sublime. Between the 14 things between us, nothing was a miss- each was actually a revelation. Service was professional, though I did have to wait a bit longer than I may have expected for wine and bread, but taking in the whole experience in totality- it's a minor quibble and so still 5 stars. Plus, we had a lovely local couple next to us who eat there every year and we enjoyed our conversation immensely. It was just a fantastic evening.

u65LJ6sVdBrR_Ni2NsPpAw.text: First Michelin star experience and it didn't disappoint! Tasting menu at a very reasonable price. The dining experience was worth it alone. Food very prepared very well, and service was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom

Jp2bcpwQUCudQUL7VVRV_A.text: Dissapointing. Only two items we would want to eat again, and found our selves describing our courses as " not terrible" "it's fine" "okay I guess". Not what you'd expect for a Michelin star restaurant. We know fine dining well and this sadly fell very short.   The good:  The staff were all very friendly! Had some great conversations.   The mushroom soup which was given to start was wonderful!   The Seaweed Butter and Sourdough bread were excellent  The Truffle Scallop Rissotto was divine!  The Moscato was magnificent   However,  Service: Time between service and even to receive menus was excessive. The dessert took a very long time we were told because our souffle fell. Hmmm  The shrimp and cabbage dish was very poorly done. Shrimp were rubbery :(  The best thing on the plate of duck with carrots, potatoes, and a creamed Swiss chard was the Swiss Chard. The potatoes were inedible. Extremely greasy!  One of the wine pairings burned your nostrils and tasted like kerosene.   The souffle itself lacked flavor and the apricot sauce they added made it worse.   When asked if he liked one of the items in particular our server replied "not at all". There you have it! A place whose staff doesn't like the food.   Sad :(. We actually included Edinburgh in our travel itinerary so we could dine here. Frankly expected more for the star, reputation, and nearly 300 pounds.

KEdHhDJQFRQm2XARzntWvQ.text: Phoarr!  This place is elegant, exquisite and by far the best Michelin star restaurant here in Edinburgh that I have tried so far.  I have yet to try 21212 or Balmoral No. 1.  I have been to The Kitchin & Castle Terrace and between the 3, this is by far the best.  I am not going into how all the food taste as we went for the tasting menu and there would be just too much of them to review and remember.  Unlike the other 2 Michelin starred restaurant that I have been to in Edinburgh, the food here was very consistent and the flavour and taste just exploded in your mouth with each and every course.  I will let the picture which I have taken speaks for itself.  How you imagine they would taste like from the picture, it was exactly how they tasted.  Let your imagination run wild.  Alternatively, if you have the money, please do come here for the tasting menu and you will absolutely not regret it.  I have been to the Gordon Ramsay Restaurant in London which is a 3 Michelin star and this place still trumps the Gordon Ramsay Restaurant.  I think this is a restaurant worthy of the next 2 Michelin stars.  Expensive but definitely a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom

-Yw28wU9TKHmVpcq7L_odQ.text: Came here alone because I was given indication that this was THE best restaurant in Edinburgh. Aizle, comes up in the same list, but I won't know until Sunday.  I must say, they have a well coordinated team, with superb professionalism from before you even enter the building. A well dressed gentleman in a suit was the first impression I received upon my entry. He quickly asked if he could stow my bags and coat and I was directly taken to my seat by a charming hostess.  I could go on about the tasty South African Cabernet I had. Or perhaps the fantastic delicacies, that were presented with absolute excellence. But I don't want to spoil the surprise. (Go for the 8 course. Refrain from eating all day, if you will, as it will fill you up.)  Every detail is payed very close attention to by each staff member.  If you leave to go use the washroom, your napkin is neatly folded and place on your table, ready for use again. If the food arrives in your absence, they cover it and standby until your return. Your water and wine will never be emtpy, (Also note, the glass and silverware here are of fine and high quality.  You can tell, just from drinking a glass of water.). You are always given a new set of appropriate silverware, with each new dish.  The staff here take delight in conversation with you and asking for feedback on the dishes.  This is definitively a restaurant of a higher class and caliber, so dress appropriately, because everyone here suits up. Very classy, very professional. Even though, I didn't show up in a suit, (I had slacks, a Ralph Lauren thin sweater, dress shoes, and a peacoat), I was not looked up at all with disdain, the way some of the other arrogant restaurants I have been into, back in America, if you weren't in a suit. No discrimination here. Just come here with an appreciation for fine wine and dining, and some good company, or not, and you'll have a memorable night in Edinburgh.  It was my first night in Edinburgh, Scotland, and I am so glad that this restaurant set the tone for the rest of my stay here.  I fully recommend this place to everyone. Make it a point to set reservations here. Every time I step foot in Edinburgh, I will have dinner here. They have respectfully earned my business with their service and food quality. I am a customer for the next few decades to come.

ZnAF-DdZ9fW6ilDbbko6nw.text: Don't be scared of the Michelin Star or the formality of the dining room.  Service was friendly and the lunch prix fixe is an amazing deal.  the day we were there there was a mix of business lunches, a wedding party, a few dates and a few tourists.  They were accommodating to my boyfriends gluten free requirement and the food was, needless to say, top notch.  What really impressed me was the wines I ordered.  One Borgogne white and a Bordeaux.  If I was at the end of my day and no the start, I would have been happy to drink more but alas, it was not to be.  If you do order the foie gras terrine, be warned it is a VERY generous serving.  It would easily be enough for 2-3 and yes I ate the whole thing.

HhNtOjdPK5twg9kWgjB2pg.text: Experienced an extraordinary dinner for four.   The food was superlative and I also very much enjoyed that while service was certainly just about perfect (to me that means thorough, knowledgable but unintrusive), there was a warmth and lack of stuffiness to it that is wanting in many Michelin-starred restaurants and was quite refreshing.   We all very much enjoyed the chef's tasting with wine pairing and perhaps the best part came at the end when we all eagerly answered YES to whether we'd like cheese to finish our meal.   The server (who wasn't French, btw, so not all of them are...) came by with the cheese cart and went over the varieties. He was clearly someone who was not only very knowledgable but really seems to love what he does. The four of us decided with him to make two plates, one mild cheeses, one stinky cheeses and wow every one of them was just incredible and went beautifully with the Champagne we ordered to finish the meal with.   Would love to return...

photos.caption: Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom. Passion fruit cream and confit pineapple.
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mmmm, stinky cheese.
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom. Milder cheese selection.

08WYXliQ9MIqa1hJvOJzAw.text: Came here for dinner, everything we ate except for one thing was great. Staff were very attentive. Nice looking reataurant. Don't order the lemon Panna cotta because it tastes like mint toothpaste, they are super heavy handed with however they are using the mint and it kills all other flavors in the dish. The chocolate desert was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom

zvuM9nw0NhblL-iUctvkQg.text: Spectacular dining experience. The finest service I have ever had, an imaginative menu, and stellar wine pairings made our 2 1/2 hour lunch fly by far too quickly. And it was one of the few times I've been to such a highly rated establishment and actually felt comfortable and welcome - the staff genuinely want you to enjoy your visit and come back again. This is the definition of destination dining.

8ADgMeZoXOqRMiN_T-SFuw.text: As I live and breathe this was probably the greatest dining experience of my life.  Other half took me on Friday night as a birthday treat, and my god a treat it was. From the moment you walk in the door you know you are somewhere special. Greeted at the door we need not even give them our name, based on the time and without any notes in site he greets us both by name....!  With no hurry given to reviewing the menu we were instead given a beetroot macaroon with horseradish cream and asked if we wish to have an aperitif. Once that had arrived and we had begun to enjoy it and relax we were then presented with the menu, expertly explained by the waiter.  For me it had to be the tasting menu, other half went for the shellfish tasting menu. We both had the wine pairing. What happened next I don't have words for:  7 courses of the most exquisite cooking I have ever had the pleasure to witness. From the amuse bouche of 3 tasters including salsify, scallop and salmon mousse, to the scallop with pigs trotter puy lentils, duck with morels, ox tongue and potato.....it just kept coming! The wine with each course seemed to get better, some how not clahing against the last.  At the end of the meal we were privileged enough to be taken on a tour of the kitchen. If this is was michelin dining is about....I want more of it.  To say this place is JD Recommended is as big an understatement as can be made! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sea bream!!! Top dish
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ox tongue! So delicious!
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom. Monkfish &amp; Comte

m9a_rsNRNPJB4rrQDWHwzw.text: Another winner of a meal from Wisharts. Service spot on, food...too amazing to describe. Overall experience an Edinburgh must-do. Book in advance, sign up to their online newsletter as you actually get the odd 'deal' sent through. their cook school is also worth doing. Last minute offers to be had also.   I stand by my first review. If I could eat like this everyday oh boy would I!!!!

uzPDvv41WPN4mXboxCdmGA.text: My favourite restaurant in Edinburgh. It is flawless. The ambience and service are always excellent. The food is always divine. It deserves more than one Michelin star. No regrets.

GOSjnqeZCc1BQ9Z5F6JlIA.text: Best restaurant I've ever been to. Simply superb! I've been to the cook school twice also and have had the best time. Can't wait to go back. Thank you for a great experience

fr4ulKKIuZt-vmsSQmfG-A.text: Surprised by the small amount of reviews?  This place in my opinion is the best of the Michelins in Edinburgh (and yes I have tried them all..) I feel like I could eat the food here every day, there is a lightness of touch in the preparation that really comes through when compared to it's ilk.  Recommending the set lunch, very good value at 27 for 3 courses. Thing about michelin places is the bread is always very good so you can stock up on that as they will never refuse you more (thrift recommendation #1)  Service is attentive but not stuffy even though the room is pretty formal. You can tell everyone involved here is really interested in good food from the lowest water pourer up to the head chef.  If you have the budget come and eat here. I would recommend getting a bottle of wine from a shop and drinking it on the picnic benches at the shore before you go in. The wine list is good but the markup is over 300% in places. Plus the water of leith can be nice on a good day. (Thrifty tip #2 - Edinburgh has no open container law so don't worry about kicking about with a bottle of wine).

iHMlRXKjJq0ptJLVuQmrQw.text: This is in my top five places I have ever eaten at. Should you choose to dine here you will most definitely not be disappointed. The food is expertly crafted down to the finest details.  This restaurant truly captures the imagination and is not just a place to go eat a fancy meal, this is a place to have an experience.

SY_x4gUJipZwMkZCBeR_xA.text: They deserve their Michelin star. We had a great lunch and the service was very good and friendly without going overboard. Why all their waiters are French I do not know but it does not matter as long as the service was as good as it was.

1TGYSKJ3zPI_i7Drlt-fnQ.text: This is one of the only Michelin Star Restaurant in Edinburgh. It's located off the beaten track (or in other words, down at Leith) and is something quite special to Edinburgh. I quite like getting in a taxi and going down to Leith, it almost feels as if I'm in a different city altogether!  The restaurant is funky, as my mum described it. It's nice, modern and clean, but maybe could do with a touch more excitement. But you don't go to a Michelin Star restaurant for the decor. The food was, as expected, delicious. The best part is there is always a good deal on to eat here, so you can get amazing food for next to nothing! I had lamb with vegetables in an orange sauce, which was YUMMY and my dad had steak, which he loved.   It's a brilliant place to come to for a special occasion!

photos.caption: Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom. Courtesy of Website
Photo of Martin Wishart - edinburgh, United Kingdom. Courtesy of Website

oJ7uFPOlfyeyq8ZDf6q8Qg.text: One of the best meals I have ever eaten.  First of all, they have a vegetarian tasting menu.  The service is impeccable.  The food was incredible.  The place is expensive, but worth it. Don't miss this restaurant when you go to Edinburgh.

CcgQgRRD5R4eXErEDOhn3A.text: This is very approachable high-end food and well worth the price. The five course tasting menu with a glass of wine gets you out at about 80. Try to leave room for the cheese if you can - it looks divine but it's hard to squeeze in after deceptively filling courses.
